remarks.para: Depth-stencil state controls how depth-stencil testing is performed by the output-merger stage.
The formats that support stenciling are DXGI_FORMAT_D24_UNORM_S8_UINT and DXGI_FORMAT_D32_FLOAT_S8X24_UINT.

summary.para: A Boolean value that enables depth testing. The default value is TRUE.
A member of the enumerated type that identifies a portion of the depth-stencil buffer that can be modified by depth data. The default value is D3D10_DEPTH_WRITE_MASK_ALL.
A member of the enumerated type that defines how depth data is compared against existing depth data. The default value is D3D10_COMPARISON_LESS
A Boolean value that enables stencil testing. The default value is FALSE.
A value that identifies a portion of the depth-stencil buffer for reading stencil data. The default value is D3D10_DEFAULT_STENCIL_READ_MASK.
A value that identifies a portion of the depth-stencil buffer for writing stencil data. The default value is D3D10_DEFAULT_STENCIL_WRITE_MASK.
A structure that identifies how to use the results of the depth test and the stencil test for pixels whose surface normal is facing toward the camera.
A structure that identifies how to use the results of the depth test and the stencil test for pixels whose surface normal is facing away from the camera.
